_header: By wit of man all thing that is contrived
_description: John Lydgate, ‘A song of Iust Mesure’ — in 8-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Nothyng commendyd but it in measure be’

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
By wytte of man A thyng that is contryvedstandyth in proporcion
                    playnlye to conclude…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…so as thow weyest be mercy or RygourThe same mesure shall be
                    done to the
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author:
by Iohn lidgate (squeezed between last line and rubric title, f. 124; by
                    scribe, Stow)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Explicit the songe of Iust mesure writen by Iohn stowe (in rubric below
                    last line, f. 124; by scribe, Stow)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 772-5 (composite text, 13 stanzas).

BLHar2251.First Lines:
BY witte of man al thyng that is contryvedStandith in proporcioun
                    plainly to conclude…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…So as thow weyest be mercy or RigoureThe mesure same shalbe
                    don to the
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 80-3.
